snippet: The California Department of Corrections has agreed to pay $850,000 to settle a lawsuit by a former Folsom State Prison inmate who said his broken neck had gone untreated while he was serving a sentence for methamphetamine possession.    The state...
lead_paragraph: The California Department of Corrections has agreed to pay $850,000 to settle a lawsuit by a former Folsom State Prison inmate who said his broken neck had gone untreated while he was serving a sentence for methamphetamine possession. The state admitted no wrongdoing in paying the man, Steven Dodson, 47, who is now partly paralyzed.
abstract: California Department of Corrections will pay $850,000 to settle lawsuit by former Folsom State Prison inmate, Steven Dodson, who says his broken neck went untreated while he was serving sentence for drug possession (S)
